quote_a: It kind of didn’t read or interpret what I wanted. But again, I don’t see that as an AI problem. AI is not plugged into my brain; I still have to give it something to go on.
quote_b: Perfect personal AI assistant. But probably to take my mom brain and interpret all the things, plug into my brain, see everything gosh. It sounds very scary. But see everything I read, whether it’s on WhatsApp or on school newsletters or hear about or talk about, and almost come up with a to do list or an events calendar.
explanation: She defends AI not being plugged into her brain as a reasonable and accepted limitation, then describes her ideal AI as doing exactly that — plugging into her brain to interpret everything.
